name: Zara Volkov
title: Lady Zara of the Obsidian
core_wound: Grew up hearing about her great-uncle Pavel's death and her family's victimization; raised on stories of injustice and aristocratic betrayal; channeled pain into righteous fury for all the oppressed
wants: To overthrow the corrupt aristocratic system and create true equality across all seven systems
needs: To learn that revolution requires building something new, not just destroying what exists; to channel rage into constructive change
voice_markers: Passionate and fiery - speaks like she's always giving a speech
Uses revolutionary rhetoric and worker solidarity language
Tends to see things in black and white - very little gray area
Frequently interrupts and talks over people when excited
contradiction: Fights for the working class while being aristocracy herself; claims to want equality while enjoying privileges; preaches non-violence while planning armed revolt
physical_description: Striking and intense with wild dark hair often pulled back hastily. Gray eyes that seem to burn with conviction. Deliberately dresses in practical workers' clothes rather than aristocratic finery. Has burn scars on her hands from 'working alongside' miners (actually from one clumsy visit).

relationships.Dmitri_Volkov: Grandfather; she's his favorite though he fears her radicalism; she thinks he's become too soft and compromised
relationships.Nikolai_Volkov: Older brother; she thinks he's too cautious and has been co-opted by the system; loves him but sees him as weak
relationships.Victoria_Ashford: Secret friend through encrypted communications; unlikely alliance of two rebels; Victoria tempers Zara's extremism
relationships.Rafe_Stone: Working class organizer she's been collaborating with; developing romantic feelings though she tells herself revolution comes first
relationships.The_Workers: She sees herself as their champion; they're skeptical of aristocrat playing revolutionary but warming to her genuine passion
relationships.Marcus_Ashford: Enemy; son of the family that killed her great-uncle; hasn't met him but hates him on principle

secrets: Planning actual armed uprising with worker cells across multiple stations
In contact with Victoria Ashford - would be seen as betrayal by grandfather
Romantically attracted to Rafe Stone but denies it because it would 'distract from the cause'
Stole weapons from Volkov family armory to arm workers
Has evidence that Transit Authority is manipulating both Ashfords and Volkovs for profit
knowledge_state: Deep understanding of revolutionary theory and tactics
Knows about worker organization networks across all seven systems
Aware of weapons trafficking and resistance movements
Does not know her grandfather is negotiating peace with Ashfords
Does not know that Pavel Volkov's death might have been an accident
